column5: Thanks buddy.  I like it.LOL
How do ya like me now?
Hope all is well B.  Give me a call okay!
Good for you to get out with your lad, Brian. Good Luck with your eyes, hope it works out, man.

The plan for the weekend was to get up to ma and pops for some fishing with my youngest boy(27) and pop. But friday turned out to be a bit of a set back for myself. Some issues with my eyes had me in to see a doc. The out come was alittle heart breaking,so I really wasnt in the mood to go anywhere. But after siting around the rest of the day,feeling crappie,I decided we would head up saturday morning and fish. The only thing is,I cant be fishing when the sun is out at it,s brightest,so an evening fish and a early sunday morning fish,was what we could musture up. Wasnt that bad though. Got my first smallie on the fly popper saturday night,and one this morning, and got to spend some time with my boy.Fish were popping all around. Alot of hits,I was setting the popper to soon.  I thought this made a better report.  Thanks for the help on the converting guys.   <embed width="600" height="361" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowFullscreen="true" allowNetworking="all" wmode="transparent" src="http://static.photobucket.com/player.swf" flashvars="file=http%3A%2F%2Fvid1234.photobucket.com%2Falbums%2Fff417%2Fbrianb64%2FMovie_0001.mp4">     This shot turned out pretty cool.    My boy.     I hope this is nothing that will keep me away from something I just started to fall in love with,but maybe I,ll be forced now,to hit the prime times.LOL  Thanks for reading.
Awesome report Brian Sorry to hear of the set backs... hope it's not too serious Looks like you all had a blast Thanks for sharing TJunkie
great report   looks like a fun way to catch smallies
Hey thanks  Can you lighten up that pic of my son and I?
No worries Jaq. All will be fine.
Not really Brian the thing is too low quality to do much
hope you don't mind me taking it and trying some levels on it. can't do much about the sharpness though.
Hey Brian , got bored so I tried to do some editing on that dark photo, its a bit lighter..
forgot to add I hope things get better re:your eyes
Thanks guys.
This one lightened up a bit too Brian.  Good to see you & your son enjoying each others company so much !!
Thanks Lew. The pic was shot at ,or about, 10pm.Betty need to use the flash more.LOL LOL
great to get out with the family  . Hope its nothing serious with the eyes. Perhaps pickeral fishing is in the future?
well I got the background to lighten up but that trouble with the foreground           I might have cheated a bit..LOL
Looks like a heck of a good spot to fish!!!,great pictures Brian!!.Sorry to hear about your eyes,hopefully you can get that fixed up soon.
They're right that you can't do much about quality I adjusted it a little more, hope it helps. And good luck with the eyes (and pickerel)
cool. And a WGSF to boot

Im not even gonna attempt to fix the pictures as I have no clue on it.  Congrats for getting out with your boy Fly fishing was always fun I know I should get back to it some time. Sorry to here your having trouble with your eyes I hope they can fix you up but on a good not at least they said you cant fish during high sun it could be worse and only able to fish high sun.
Great report with the boy me Brudder. Take care of those eyes.
Thanks again all.  I edited my post.I like it now.   Seen the doc again today.  Pressure has dropped,now they can work on getting thing better for me.  Lots to do still.
Very nice Brian.
Good to hear Brian.

Thanks for the report Brian. Hope all works out well with your eyes. I still can't believe your youngest is in his 20's...geez how old are you! By the way, picked up some pressure treated plywood today, turns out home hardware doesn't sell oil based paint anymore though

B i just had surgery on both my eyes over the last two weeks....still on the mend (drops regiment)...i can see like a 19 year old again but i do have to wear reading glasses now....hope yours gets sorted out  i thought this was cool too 279/Twocoda/BrianFlyinHeavyHDR.jpg[/img]
